member.name: T:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.ContentSecurityPolicyConstants
member.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy response header allows web site administrators to control resources the user agent is allowed to load for a given page. With a few exceptions, policies mostly involve specifying server origins and script endpoints. This helps guard against cross-site scripting attacks (XSS).

Elements controlled by object-src are perhaps coincidentally considered legacy HTML elements and are not recieving new standardized features(such as the security attributes sandbox or allow for iframe). Therefore it is recommended to restrict this fetch-directive (e.g.explicitly set object-src 'none' if possible).

member.name: T:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants
member.summary: The HTTP Feature-Policy header provides a mechanism to allow and deny the use of browser features in its own frame, and in content within any iframe elements in the document.

member.name: T:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.Directive
member.summary: Fetch directives control locations from which certain resource types may be loaded.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.Directive.AllowAll
member.summary: The feature will be allowed in this document, and all nested browsing contexts(iframes) regardless of their origin.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.Directive.AllowSelf
member.summary: The feature will be allowed in this document, and in all nested browsing contexts (iframes) in the same origin.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.Directive.AllowSrc
member.summary: (In an iframe allow attribute only) The feature will be allowed in this iframe, as long as the document loaded into it comes from the same origin as the URL in the iframe's src attribute.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.Directive.DenyAll
member.summary: The feature is disabled in top-level and nested browsing contexts.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.Directive.AllowOrigin
member.summary: The feature is allowed for specific origins(for example, https://example.com). Origins should be separated by a space.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.Header
member.summary: Header value for Feature-Policy

member.name: T:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures
member.summary: Feature Policy allows web developers to selectively enable, disable, and modify the behavior of certain features and APIs in the browser. It is similar to Content Security Policy but controls features instead of security behavior.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.Accelerometer
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to gather information about the acceleration of the device through the Accelerometer interface.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.AmbientLightSensor
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to gather information about the amount of light in the environment around the device through the AmbientLightSensor interface.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.Autoplay
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to autoplay media requested through the HTMLMediaElement interface. When this policy is enabled and there were no user gestures, the Promise returned by HTMLMediaElement.play() will reject with a DOMException. The autoplay attribute on audio and video elements will be ignored.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.Battery
member.summary: Controls whether the use of the Battery Status API is allowed. When this policy is enaled, the Promise returned by Navigator.getBattery() will reject with a NotAllowedError DOMException.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.Camera
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to use video input devices. When this policy is enabled, the Promise returned by getUserMedia() will reject with a NotAllowedError DOMException.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.DisplayCapture
member.summary: Controls whether or not the current document is permitted to use the getDisplayMedia() method to capture screen contents. When this policy is enabled, the promise returned by getDisplayMedia() will reject with a NotAllowedError if permission is not obtained to capture the display's contents.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.DocumentDomain
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to set document.domain. When this policy is enabled, attempting to set document.domain will fail and cause a SecurityError DOMException to be be thrown.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.EncryptedMedia
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to use the Encrypted Media Extensions API (EME). When this policy is enabled, the Promise returned by Navigator.requestMediaKeySystemAccess() will reject with a DOMException.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.ExecutionWhileNotRendered
member.summary: Controls whether tasks should execute in frames while they're not being rendered (e.g. if an iframe is hidden or display: none).

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.ExecutionWhileOutOfViewport
member.summary: Controls whether tasks should execute in frames while they're outside of the visible viewport.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.Fullscreen
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to use Element.requestFullScreen(). When this policy is enabled, the returned Promise rejects with a TypeError DOMException.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.Geolocation
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to use the Geolocation Interface. When this policy is enabled, calls to getCurrentPosition() and watchPosition() will cause those functions' callbacks to be invoked with a PositionError code of PERMISSION_DENIED.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.Gyroscope
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to gather information about the orientation of the device through the Gyroscope interface.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.LayoutAnimations
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to show layout animations.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.LegacyImageFormats
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to display images in legacy formats.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.Magnetometer
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to gather information about the orientation of the device through the Magnetometer interface.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.Microphone
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to use audio input devices. When this policy is enabled, the Promise returned by MediaDevices.getUserMedia() will reject with a NotAllowedError.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.Midi
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to use the Web MIDI API. When this policy is enabled, the Promise returned by Navigator.requestMIDIAccess() will reject with a DOMException.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.NavigationOverride
member.summary: Controls the availability of mechanisms that enables the page author to take control over the behavior of spatial navigation, or to cancel it outright.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.OversizedImages
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to download and display large images.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.Payment
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to use the Payment Request API. When this policy is enabled, the PaymentRequest() constructor will throw a SecurityError DOMException.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.PictureInPicture
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to play a video in a Picture-in-Picture mode via the corresponding API.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.PublickeyCredentials
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to use Web Authentication API to create, store, and retreive public-key credentials.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.Speaker
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to play audio via any methods.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.SyncXhr
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to make synchronous XMLHttpRequest requests.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.Usb
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to use the WebUSB API.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.WakeLock
member.summary: Controls whether the current document is allowed to use Wake Lock API to indicate that device should not enter power-saving mode.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.FeaturePolicyConstants.HttpFeatures.XrSpatialTracking
member.summary: Controls whether or not the current document is allowed to use the WebXR Device API to interact with a WebXR session.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.ReferrerPolicyConstants.NoReferrerWhenDowngrade
member.summary: This is the default behavior if no policy is specified, or if the provided value is invalid. The origin, path, and querystring of the URL are sent as a referrer when the protocol security level stays the same (HTTP→HTTP, HTTPS→HTTPS) or improves (HTTP→HTTPS), but isn't sent to less secure destinations (HTTPS→HTTP).

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.ReferrerPolicyConstants.Origin
member.summary: Only send the origin of the document as the referrer. For example, a document at https://example.com/page.html will send the referrer https://example.com/.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.ReferrerPolicyConstants.OriginWhenCrossOrigin
member.summary: Send the origin, path, and query string when performing a same-origin request, but only send the origin of the document for other cases.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.ReferrerPolicyConstants.SameOrigin
member.summary: A referrer will be sent for same-site origins, but cross-origin requests will send no referrer information.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.ReferrerPolicyConstants.StrictOrigin
member.summary: A referrer will be sent for same-site origins, but cross-origin requests will send no referrer information.

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.ReferrerPolicyConstants.StrictOriginWhenCrossOrigin
member.summary: Send the origin, path, and query string when performing a same-origin request, but only send the origin of the document for other cases

member.name: F:Aark.SecurityHeaders.Extension.Constants.ReferrerPolicyConstants.UnsafeUrl
member.summary: Send the origin, path, and query string when performing any request, regardless of security This policy will leak potentially-private information from HTTPS resource URLs to insecure origins. Carefully consider the impact of this setting.
